home.intro1: This microsite was built in approximately an hour using AI tools. It serves as a practical demonstration of what's possible when you leverage modern AI-powered development workflows.
home.intro2: Throughout this resource, I'll walk you through:
home.bullet2: The AI tools and platforms I use daily
home.bullet4: AI tools, learning materials, communities, AI terms, and step-by-step app building guides
home.conclusion: This site itself is proof that with the right AI tools and approach, anyone can create professional digital solutions quickly and effectively.
home.feature1: Clear definitions of key AI, ML, and platform terms with links to authoritative sources
home.feature2: Detailed agendas, walkthroughs, and resources for hands-on learning experiences
home.feature3: Step-by-step tutorials for building custom GPTs, deep research, and coding integrations
home.section1: Comparative guides for Gemini, Claude, Grok, and OpenAI with example prompts and best practices
home.section2: Architecture overviews, prompt design strategies, and agent orchestration techniques
home.section3: IDE workflows, version control, AI assistants, and deployment pipelines
home.section4: Clear, concise explanations of LLMs, embeddings, vector stores, APIs, and more

summary.title: Meeting Summary
summary.quickRecapText: A former corporate executive shared his journey into AI and demonstrated various AI tools and their applications, including document scanning, research, and media creation capabilities. The session concluded with guidance on effective AI usage, emphasizing privacy considerations, prompt engineering, and practical applications for both personal and professional projects.
summary.nextSteps1: Team to explore and practice using different AI models that they haven't used before.
summary.nextSteps2: Team to implement AI projects following the sprint process outlined.
summary.nextSteps3: Team to work in small groups to develop AI solutions that could make Aalto Energia the first renewable energy company in Finland powered by AI.
summary.nextSteps4: Team to consider how to clean up their data using AI solutions as mentioned during the discussion.
summary.nextSteps5: Team to explore deep research methodology using multiple AI models for important projects requiring accuracy.
summary.nextSteps6: Team to review their AI privacy settings across different platforms they use.
summary.nextSteps7: Potentially return for a follow-up session to help build an actual AI solution.
summary.section1Text: The meeting began with Mika confirming their readiness to implement cutting-edge AI solutions. Insights were submitted and details confirmed. The discussion included the use of AI for tasks like document scanning, with Google AI performing well in this area. The event, themed "AI Kick Off," aimed to explore AI's significance in the energy sector, with Mika emphasizing its potential impact and inviting help to navigate this new phase.
summary.section2Text: A former corporate executive shared his journey into AI after leaving his job of 20 years to focus on learning and applying AI. A quick AI-generated video was demonstrated and an AI stack was outlined, which includes tools for thinking and research, building and creating, and automation. The importance of hands-on learning with AI was emphasized, with the session demonstrating practical applications and allowing participants to experiment with various AI tools.
summary.section3Text: Various AI tools and their applications were demonstrated, including Google AI Studio, Claude, and Google Notebook LM. The session explained how to create custom GPT models, use AI for coding and creative writing, and leverage different AI tools for specific tasks. A methodology for conducting deep research using multiple AI models to ensure accuracy and credibility was also shared. The importance of using AI tools effectively and responsibly was emphasized, citing an example of AI-generated research that was later found to be inaccurate.
summary.section4Text: The importance of verifying AI-generated content was discussed, particularly in professional settings, emphasizing the use of "deep research" by asking multiple Large Language Models (LLMs) the same question to ensure accuracy. Participants were encouraged to experiment with different LLMs, such as Google AI Studio, Perplexity, and Claude, to explore their capabilities and create prompts for deep research. The benefits of consolidating information from various sources to produce high-quality outputs were highlighted.
summary.section5Title: AI Tools for Research and Media
summary.section5Text: Various AI tools for research and media creation were discussed. The session explained how to use ChatGPT and other AI models like Gemini for deep research and creating visual content. The differences between Google AI Studio and Gemini were explored, noting that Google AI Studio is free but less accessible, while Gemini offers more features but requires payment. The evolving landscape of stock images was also touched on, suggesting that AI-generated images could soon replace traditional stock photos.
summary.section6Text: AI video generation capabilities were demonstrated and the limitations and potential issues with AI-generated content were discussed, particularly with objects like glasses and bottles. How AI can be used for personal assistance and expert advice was explained, emphasizing the importance of verifying information, especially for critical matters like taxes and legal advice. The "four P's" framework for optimizing AI usage was introduced: personas, privacy, projects, and prompts, highlighting the significance of personalizing AI interactions, managing privacy settings, organizing projects for better context, and crafting effective prompts.
summary.section7Title: AI Privacy Settings and Data Policies
summary.section7Text: The privacy settings and data usage policies of different AI models were discussed, highlighting the importance of understanding how personal data is handled. It was explained that Anthropic's Claude is more conservative with data by default, while ChatGPT automatically opts users in for data sharing. A past issue was mentioned where shared chat URLs could be indexed by Google, potentially exposing personal information. Attendees were encouraged to review their privacy settings and consider the trade-offs between data sharing and the benefits of AI assistance.
summary.section8Text: The importance of understanding privacy settings and the risks associated with sharing information on various platforms was discussed, emphasizing the need for caution, especially with AI tools like Grok. The significance of prompt engineering was highlighted and examples were provided of how to effectively use projects and iteration with AI tools. The importance of context and feedback in improving AI outputs was explained, noting that while precise prompts are crucial for deep research, iterative feedback is more beneficial for other tasks.
summary.section9Text: How to use AI for prompt engineering and creating minimum viable products (MVPs) was demonstrated. A process was explained involving brainstorming, generating ideas, and developing project requirements documents that can be used to create AI-powered solutions. The importance of context, privacy, and effective prompting when interacting with AI was emphasized. An example of a custom GPT model that collects and analyzes user responses from interviews was shown, demonstrating how free tools can be linked to create useful applications.
summary.section10Text: A custom GPT application for conducting interviews in English or Finnish was demonstrated, which includes voice capabilities and can be customized with company logos and questions. Participants were encouraged to explore the tool and guidance was provided on using AI for learning and personal projects, emphasizing that if they don't know how to do something with AI, they can ask AI to teach them. It was recommended that participants choose a personal project to apply AI skills, and links to resources and a summary of the meeting were provided for further reference.
summary.section11Text: Experience with AI learning resources and a structured approach to building AI solutions was shared. How to use AI tools like ChatGPT to create project requirements documents, prototypes, and websites without coding skills was explained, suggesting a sprint-based methodology for teams to develop AI-powered solutions. Questions about using AI to assess and improve data quality were addressed, with guidance provided on how to structure the problem, gather context, and use AI to analyze and propose solutions.
summary.section12Text: Insights on effective AI usage were shared, emphasizing iterative prototyping, time-boxed activities, and leveraging diverse team expertise. The importance of focusing on learning specific tools rather than trying to become an AI expert was highlighted, and demonstrations showed how to use AI for coding tasks like creating a simple tennis game. Participants expressed interest in applying these concepts to improve their efficiency and learn new AI tools.

about.name: Andrew Kilshaw
about.role: AI & Digital Transformation | Organizational Capability Expert
about.intro: Deep practitioner experience in transforming and empowering industry-leading global Fortune 500 organizations to realize their full potential. Currently focused on leveraging AI to create innovative digital solutions that empower human and organizational development.
about.currentFocusPara1: For the past year, I've stepped out of the corporate world to dive deep into AI and explore how to leverage it for both personal use and professional impact. My journey has focused on understanding the transformative potential of artificial intelligence and developing practical, agentic AI solutions.
about.currentFocusPara2: I'm now creating digital solutions in the space I know well ‚Äî helping companies and individuals realize their full potential ‚Äî but with AI as a powerful enabler of human capability and organizational transformation.
about.talentOptimaPara: Portfolio career combining three inter-related passions:
about.talentOptimaPassion1: Leveraging practitioner experience to help complex global organizations supercharge their enterprise approach to Organizational Capability & Transformation
about.talentOptimaPassion2: Engineering best-in-class digital solutions through advanced understanding of AI, Machine Learning and Analytics that empower human and organizational potential
about.talentOptimaPassion3: Partnering with faculty at global Business Schools (e.g. IMD) to bring real-world examples into the classroom, collaborating on the intersection of research and practice
about.sanofiRole: Group Head (SVP) of Organizational Capability & Transformation
about.sanofiPara: Global biopharma company (90k+ employees, ‚Ç¨42B revenue). Reported to CPO and built a new function of 300+ people delivering impact across:

about.shellPara: Led 200+ global OD & Learning professionals for Shell's $300B+ revenue Downstream business (34k employees).
about.shellAchievement: Key Achievement: Delivered complete global business transformation (300+ project team) resulting in $1B+ additional EBIT while accelerating the Energy Transition.
about.nikeRole1Title: VP HR ‚Äì Asia Pacific & Latin America (2017‚Äì2019)
about.nikeRole1Desc: Led 70+ HR professionals across 9k employees in Nike's most complex $6B+ geography. Executive Leadership Team member for APLA business.
about.nikeRole2Desc: Transformed Nike's digital capabilities, enabling 35% CAGR eCommerce growth.
about.nikeRole3Title: Head of Strategy & HR, Jordan Brand (2014‚Äì2016)
about.nikeRole3Desc: Defined five-year strategy to double $2.5B business revenues. Pitched strategy to Michael Jordan.
about.nikeRole4Desc: Created Nike's first Corporate University (NikeU), leading 75+ globally. Featured in IMD case study.
about.blackrockDesc: Led talent management, innovation, and BlackRock-BGI merger integration. Managed board succession and created iShares Innovation Office.
about.education2School: University of Manchester, UK & Universit√© Sabatier, France

header.title: Introduction to the Session
header.subtitle: Welcome! Let's set the stage for an exciting, hands-on learning experience.

sessionOverview.heroSubtitle: You will PRACTICE, not just watch!
sessionOverview.principle1Title: AI is Best Learned by DOING
sessionOverview.principle1Text: Theory is great, but the real magic happens when you get your hands on the tools. Today, you'll be actively experimenting and building alongside me.
sessionOverview.principle2Title: You WILL Make Mistakes. That's PERFECT!
sessionOverview.principle2Text: The AI will make mistakes too. This isn't a bug - it's how you learn! Every error teaches you something new about how AI thinks and responds.
sessionOverview.principle3Text: Each unexpected result is an opportunity for insight. We'll embrace them together and discover what they reveal about effective AI interaction.
sessionOverview.principle4Text: This isn't a lecture - it's an adventure into what AI can do. Experiment boldly, ask questions freely, and enjoy the journey of discovery.
sessionOverview.byEnd1: Understand what AI can (and can't) do for you
sessionOverview.byEnd2: Know which AI tools to use for different tasks
sessionOverview.byEnd3: Have hands-on experience with real AI workflows
sessionOverview.byEnd4: Feel confident exploring AI on your own
sessionOverview.whatCover1: My personal AI toolkit and workflow
sessionOverview.whatCover2: Real-world use cases from my daily work
sessionOverview.whatCover3: Deep dives into research, coding, and more
sessionOverview.step1Text: Brief demonstrations of tools and techniques - just enough to get you oriented. We're keeping presentations short so you have maximum time to practice.
sessionOverview.step2Text: Immediately after each demonstration, you'll practice the same techniques yourself. This is where the real learning happens - through direct experience.
sessionOverview.step3Text: Questions are encouraged at any time! If something doesn't work as expected, we'll troubleshoot together. That's often when the best insights emerge.
sessionOverview.expect1Text: We're covering a lot in 2 hours, so we'll keep things moving. Stay engaged!
sessionOverview.expect2Text: This isn't passive learning. You'll be actively using AI tools throughout.
sessionOverview.expect3Text: We'll experiment, learn from results, and refine our approach as we go.
sessionOverview.required1: A laptop or computer (tablets may be limited)
sessionOverview.helpful1: ChatGPT or Claude account (free tier is fine)

agenda.handsOnNote: This is a HANDS-ON workshop - you'll PRACTICE, not just watch!
agenda.item1Point1: HANDS-ON workshop - you will PRACTICE, not just watch
agenda.item1Point2: AI is best learned by DOING - embrace the experience!
agenda.item1Point3: You WILL make mistakes. The AI will make mistakes. That's how you learn!
agenda.item1Point4: Mistakes are your teachers - they're opportunities for insight
agenda.item1Point5: Purpose: Have FUN while learning through direct experience
agenda.item2Title: Introduction to Andrew / Who Am I
agenda.item2Desc: Background, AI journey, and credibility in the field
agenda.item3Desc: Overview of tools used and how they integrate
agenda.item3Break1: First 7 minutes: Andrew presents the AI stack
agenda.item3Break2: Next 8 minutes: YOU play with the tools yourself!
agenda.item4Desc: Real-world use cases with hands-on practice opportunities
agenda.item4Note: Note: Includes hands-on component for participants
agenda.item5Desc: Framework for managing AI agents effectively
agenda.item5Break1: First 5 minutes: Andrew presents the 4Ps framework
agenda.item5Break2: Next 5 minutes: Participants explore their own settings
agenda.item5Topic1: Personas: Defining voice, character, and behavioral rules
agenda.item5Topic2: Privacy: Data usage, training opt-outs, and security
agenda.item5Topic3: Projects: Workstreams, files, and context management
agenda.item5Topic4: Prompts: Crafting effective instructions and interactions
agenda.item6Desc: In-depth exploration of key AI applications - HALF presentation, HALF hands-on practice for each topic
agenda.item6Topic1: Deep Research: Prompt engineering, browsing, and AI agents
agenda.item6Topic2: Media: Image and video generation techniques
agenda.item6Topic3: Coding: Chat-based generation, code vetting, and automation
agenda.item6Topic4: Efficiency: Workflow automation and agent orchestration
agenda.item6Topic5: Expertise: Domain specialization and custom models
agenda.item7Desc: Key takeaways and questions from participants
agenda.item8Desc: Links to microsite, GitHub, and further reading
agenda.item9Title: What are you going to do now?
agenda.item9Desc: Your hands-on MVP building journey starts here!
agenda.item9Topic1: Go away and brainstorm ideas for your own MVP
agenda.item9Topic2: Learn how to create a Project Requirements Document (PRD)
agenda.item9Topic3: Set up VS Code with GitHub Copilot OR Claude Code
agenda.item9Topic4: Use Claude Pro OR ChatGPT Plus to develop your ideas
agenda.item9Topic5: Take your PRD and work with coding agents to build a basic MVP
agenda.item9Topic7: Configure GitHub to auto-deploy to Netlify
agenda.item9Topic8: See and test your live site in action!
agenda.outcome1: HANDS-ON experience with modern AI tools and their practical applications
agenda.outcome2: Real practice building and deploying AI solutions - not just watching!
agenda.outcome3: Access to curated resources and ongoing support materials
agenda.outcome4: Practical strategies for integrating AI into your workflow
agenda.outcome5: A clear path forward to build your own MVP with AI coding agents
agenda.outcome6: Most importantly: Have FUN while learning!

header.title: Next Steps
header.subtitle: Let's wrap up and plan your AI journey forward

tabs.mvpSprint: What are you going to do now?

wrap.concept1: AI is learned by doing - hands-on practice beats passive learning
wrap.concept2: Mistakes are teachers - embrace errors as learning opportunities
wrap.concept3: Start simple - begin with basic tasks and build confidence
wrap.concept4: Iterate rapidly - AI enables fast experimentation and refinement
wrap.skill1: Which AI tools to use for different tasks
wrap.skill2: How to integrate tools into workflows
wrap.skill4: The 4Ps framework for managing AI agents
wrap.immediate1: Start experimenting with ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini for daily tasks
wrap.immediate2: Identify one workflow in your work that could be automated or enhanced with AI
wrap.immediate3: Set up your AI tool accounts and explore their features
wrap.immediate4: Practice prompt engineering - learn what works through trial and error
wrap.nextWeek1: Try one deep dive topic (research, image generation, or coding)
wrap.nextWeek2: Build a simple project using AI assistance
wrap.nextWeek3: Share your experiences with colleagues - teach what you've learned
wrap.yourTimeText: Ask anything - there are no silly questions. Whether it's about a specific tool, a use case you're thinking about, or clarification on something we covered.
wrap.commonQ1: Which AI tool should I start with for my specific needs?
wrap.commonQ2: How do I handle data privacy and security concerns?
wrap.commonQ3: What's the best way to learn prompt engineering?
wrap.commonQ4: How much will these tools cost for my use case?
wrap.commonQ5: Can you show me an example of [specific task]?
wrap.tip1: Be specific about your context and goals
wrap.tip2: Share what you've already tried if applicable
wrap.tip3: Ask about real challenges you're facing
wrap.tip4: Don't hesitate to ask for clarification
wrap.keepPracticingText: The best way to get better with AI is to use it every day. Start small, experiment boldly, and don't be afraid to make mistakes.
wrap.quoteText:
"The only way to do great work is to love what you do."
And with AI, you'll love how much more you can accomplish!

mvpSprint.heroTitle: Your MVP Building Journey Starts Now!
mvpSprint.heroSubtitle: Follow these steps to build and deploy your own AI-powered project
mvpSprint.accomplish3Subtitle: Share your creation with the world
mvpSprint.recommendedTool2: OR Claude Code CLI for command-line development
mvpSprint.costNote: Note: While there are monthly costs for AI tools, they're far less than hiring developers ($3,000-$10,000+ per project) and you can cancel anytime. Consider it an investment in your capability!
mvpSprint.step1Desc: Think about a simple project or tool that would be useful to you or your team
mvpSprint.step1Detail1: It should be achievable in a few hours
mvpSprint.step1Detail2: Focus on ONE core feature or function
mvpSprint.step1Detail3: Consider problems you face regularly at work
mvpSprint.step1Detail4: Don't overthink it - simpler is better for your first MVP
mvpSprint.step1Example1: A landing page for a side project
mvpSprint.step1Example2: A simple calculator or converter tool
mvpSprint.step2Desc: Use ChatGPT or Claude to help you write a clear PRD that describes what you want to build
mvpSprint.step2Detail1: Describe the project's purpose and goals
mvpSprint.step2Detail2: List the main features and functionality
mvpSprint.step2Detail3: Specify your target audience or users
mvpSprint.step2Detail4: Include any design preferences or requirements
mvpSprint.step3Desc: Get your tools ready for AI-assisted development
mvpSprint.step3OptionA: Option A: VS Code + GitHub Copilot
mvpSprint.step3OptionAReq2: Install GitHub Copilot extension ($10/month or free for students)
mvpSprint.step3Note: Note: You also need either ChatGPT Plus ($20/month) or Claude Pro ($20/month) for the AI assistance
mvpSprint.step4Title: Build Your MVP with AI Coding Agents
mvpSprint.step4Desc: Use your PRD and let AI do the heavy lifting
mvpSprint.step4Step1: Open your PRD in your AI tool (ChatGPT, Claude, or Claude Code)
mvpSprint.step4Step2: Ask the AI to create the project based on your PRD
mvpSprint.step4Step3: Review the code and ask for modifications as needed
mvpSprint.step4Step4: Test the application locally on your computer
mvpSprint.step4Step5: Iterate until it works as expected
mvpSprint.step4Tip1: Be specific about what you want changed
mvpSprint.step4Tip3: Don't be afraid to ask the AI to explain the code
mvpSprint.step4Tip4: Save your conversation - you can refer back to it later
mvpSprint.step5Desc: Version control and prepare for deployment
mvpSprint.step5Step1: Create a new repository on GitHub
mvpSprint.step5Step2: Follow the AI's guidance to push your code
mvpSprint.step5Step3: Add a README.md file describing your project
mvpSprint.step5Note: Note: The AI can help you with all the Git commands - just ask!
mvpSprint.step6Desc: Make your project live on the internet
mvpSprint.step6Step3: Configure build settings (AI can help with this)
mvpSprint.step6Step4: Deploy - Netlify will build and host your site automatically
mvpSprint.step6Step5: Get your live URL to share with others
mvpSprint.step6Bonus: Bonus: Every time you push changes to GitHub, Netlify automatically rebuilds and updates your site!
mvpSprint.step7Desc: Use your live site and continue improving it
mvpSprint.step7Action1: Visit your live site and test all features
mvpSprint.step7Action2: Share with friends or colleagues for feedback
mvpSprint.step7Action3: Make a list of improvements or new features
mvpSprint.step7Action5: Push updates to GitHub and watch them go live
mvpSprint.checklist3: Set up AI coding tool (Copilot or Claude Code)
mvpSprint.finalText: Remember: The workshop website you're looking at right now was built in 15 minutes using these exact steps. If I can do it, you can too!
mvpSprint.finalQuote: "The best time to start was yesterday. The second best time is now."
mvpSprint.finalNote: Don't wait for the perfect idea - start with something simple and learn as you build.

insights.errorRetry: Try refreshing, or check the Apps Script + Netlify logs.

header.title: Aalto AI Discovery Command Centre
header.subtitle: Real-time pulse across every discovery interview ‚Äî readiness, opportunities, and verbatim insight to fuel your next move.

metrics.interviewsCapturedInfo: Total discovery interviews completed across process, data, decision-making, and energy-sector question sets.
metrics.avgDurationInfo: Average minutes participants spent covering the full interview framework (opening, deep dive, sector-specific, readiness).
metrics.topReadinessInfo: Share of interviewees rating overall readiness after discussing technical stack, culture, and resourcing questions.
metrics.languagesInfo: Preferred language captured during context-setting so follow-ups respect Finnish/English communication preferences.

readiness.readinessInfo: Shows how many interviewees reported high, medium, or low overall readiness after discussing technical, cultural, and resource questions.

scores.scoresInfo: Average 1-5 scores from the readiness assessment covering technology stack, change culture, and available people/budget.

challenges.challengesInfo: Keywords extracted from answers about inefficient processes, data pain points, and decision bottlenecks.
challenges.noData: No keyword data yet ‚Äî capture a few interviews to light this up.

departments.departmentsInfo: Shows which departments participated, aligning with the role-specific question tracks in the framework.
departments.noData: Departments will appear here once interviews are logged.

verbatim.noInterviewsText: Once you capture interviews through the GPT, every verbatim insight will land here automatically.
verbatim.currentChallengesInfo: Direct quotes from process and operations questions about bottlenecks, frustrations, and inefficiencies.
verbatim.manualProcessesInfo: Highlights tasks participants identified as manual or repetitive during workflow discussions.
verbatim.aiOpportunitiesInfo: Ideas captured when exploring immediate, short-term, and strategic AI opportunities in the interview.
verbatim.keyInsightsInfo: Synthesis of the most important takeaways spanning readiness, sector context, and success vision prompts.
verbatim.immediatePlayInfo: Pulled from the immediate (0-3 month) AI use cases discussed during opportunity identification.
verbatim.shortTermMoveInfo: Links to 3-9 month AI initiatives highlighted in the interview roadmap conversation.
verbatim.strategicBetInfo: Informed by the strategic (9-24 month) ambition prompts covering grid optimisation, trading, and renewables.
